ai.summary: Lake Walk (Blue Route) is a 9.9 km moderate lakeside circuit in the UK, offering tranquil water views, reeds, and occasional wildlife along a clearly marked blue route.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained lake-side paths with gravel and compacted dirt. Expect flat to gently undulating sections, with occasional muddy patches after rain and some tree roots or uneven surfaces near the shore.
ai.safety_notes: Estimated duration: 2.5–3.5 hours at a comfortable pace. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress for variable weather. Stay on marked trails and heed local signage. Bring water, snacks, a charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Check the forecast before you go and let someone know your plans.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offers the most favorable conditions; the route can be enjoyed year‑round with appropriate gear.
